body:
With android 6.0, permissions aren't granted on install.  The only permission AdAway needs granted by the user is write external storage.  It doesn't use this permission for its normal functionality since it uses root rights.  However it uses this permission when exporting/importing the lists since it writes to sdcard.  The issue is, if the user doesn't grant this permission, Adaway states that it successfully exported the list even though no file will be on the sdcard.  We need to minimally error when the permission isn't granted and ideally even prompt the user to enable it.
Workaround: if user doesn't see the export file on sdcard, check the permission is actually granted and export again.
title: On Android 6.0 import/export doesn't prompt when no storage permission

body:
Can we please add an indicator in the DNS log that identifies the item listed as how they are being handled in the list, for example blocked, whitelist, blacklist, or nothing for allowed or unblocked items.

So for example say we have a bunch of items like:

xyz.com
yza.com
zab.com
abc.com

It would become:

xyz.com [blocked]
yza.com [blacklist]
zab.com [whitelist]
abc.com <- nothing so means its a new item or allowed
title: On DNS Log Item Indicators

body:
I am using adaway and I have found that I am adding new white list entry's and black list entry's often and each time I update to reflect the changes I have to download the block list source files each time, it would be fantastic if there was a way to update changes without downloading the block list source host files each time.

I mean other than exporting the entire host file and adding that as a black list then disabling the host file download. (Which works but is a pain)

Thank you for the great software.
title: update white and black list without internet/downloading new host sources

body:
When checking to see if an update is available (and when applying an update), it is important to present an indicator if one or more of the hosts sources is down.

For example, right now, mvps is down.

A typical procedure is to check for updates, and then apply them if they are available.  When checking for updates, if one or more source is down, an indicator would be appropriate, so the user can avoid replacing their master list with one missing one or more of the source lists.
title: Need indicator when a hosts source is down

body: AdAway is a perfect candidate for downloading over Tor, since it is an uncommon activity, is not interactive, and is a marker for devices that have root access.  Adding proxy support is usually quite easy to do in Java.  It would be very nice to have a proxy setting in AdAway.
title: add proxy support for use with Tor, I2P, etc

body: In order to help remove the reboot requirement, clear the Java DNS cache after any change to the hosts file
title: Clear Java DNS cache

body:
Does the apply sources button download the sources every time?
Domain sources are not updated very often, but disabling, enabling, whitelisting and blacklisting are done more frequently.
If so, it would make more sense to cache the sources locally, and update them when refreshing or if daily update activated.
title: Sources cache

body:
Let's say I have AdAway "active" (domains in hosts). I browse a website,
but something "good" is blocked. I want to whitelist it. If I activate
Tcpdump, I only see the domains that aren't blocked. So I have to
disable AdAway, log requests, whitelist, then enable again.

Now, if the web server is running, it could detect all the blocked
requests, so AdAway could log them and display them for whitelisting, it
could even differentiate them from the non-blocked by using a different
color. So, it would be possible to whitelist without disabling AdAway.
title: Whitelist blocked items through web server

body:
I am unable to download hosts files from ftp:// sources. Whenever attempting to add a ftp hosts source, I receive the following error:
"Improperly formatted URL: This is not a valid URL!"

Problem is, every ftp source I have tried is very much a valid URL; every browser I have tried to access the source from has been able to access the hosts file with no issue.

I think I have tracked down the issue, but I'm still rather new at this, so please forgive me if I am wrong. I believe the problem lies in the following 2 files:

1) https://github.com/dschuermann/ad-away/blob/master/AdAway/src/main/java/org/adaway/util/RegexUtils.java

2) https://github.com/dschuermann/ad-away/blob/master/AdAway/src/main/java/org/adaway/ui/HostsSourcesFragment.java

The first file (RegexUtils) is the real problem I believe, the issue being in line 97, "static public boolean isValidUrl(String input)". From what I've been able to glean from reading online, "public static boolean isValidUrl (String url)" returns true IFF the URL is valid, and only recognizes a URL as being valid if the URL is an about URL, asset file, content URL, data URL, local file, http URL, https URL, javascript URL, or network URL. Since ftp URLs are not included in this class of valid URLs, this "isValidUrl" boolean is returning false.

The problem in the second file lies in lines 152 and 273 with the statement, "if (RegexUtils.isValidUrl(input))". This is the source of the error, as far as I can tell, but is only resulting in an error because it is seeing "false" returned from the first script.

Therefore, if either the first file was corrected to see ftp files as being valid, or the second file were to include an exception, I think this problem would be fixed. Then again, I could be COMPLETELY off base here haha, like I said, I'm pretty new to this stuff.

One possible solution might be found here, using this script instead of the standard URLUtil:
https://android.googlesource.com/platform/cts/+/aad7208/tests/tests/webkit/src/android/webkit/cts/URLUtilTest.java 

but if this were to be a valid fix, an additional line would need to be added to the command "public void testIsValidUrl()" found on line 101, this line being "assertTrue(URLUtil.isValidUrl(VALID_FTP_URL));"

Hopefully someone with more knowledge than myself can verify this is indeed the issue and can implement a fix. Not being able to use ftp sources is really quite annoying! Haha
title: Unable to download hosts from ftp:// hosts source

body:
Hello

I installed AdAway on my Android smartphone after seeing too many ads slipping through AdBlockPlus.

It appears that both only rely on hosts, which means that embedded images are still displayed. I suggest letting user edit a regex-based filter file à la Privoxy so that even those ads are removed.

Cheers,
title: [suggestion] Add support for web filtering through regex

However, even if this did work, it's obviously not a solution since any third party wishing to use them on my website (and indeed any other website using ShareThis icons) is likely to encounter the same problem. It is not clear to me whether the problem lies with the App itself or one of lists being used. Clearly Social Media buttons are not adverts and shouldn't be blocked by the App. I would be grateful for some help here! IMK
title: AdAway Blocking ShareThis Icons

body:
Can you consider putting up to 9 hosts per line instead of one every line?
per: http://www.malwareteks.com/kb/LargeHosts.php

Even if you did 4 per line it would cut the file from 25k+ lines to 6k+ lines.

This can greatly speed up the parsing of the file by the DNS client.
Thanks for the great app!
title: Optimize Hosts File

body:
_Original author: jer...@fairbrass.co.nz (July 25, 2012 13:46:06)_

This is for a suggestion rather than a problem or bug:

Currently AdAway has the option for "check for updates daily", which is very useful for automation - I can just set it and forget it. However, daily updates are for me a bit too frequent, as I have an older and slower phone (the updates slow it right down while they're being processed), and a very limited data plan.

It would be great if AdAway could expand on the options for auto updates, to allow other frequencies to be chosen by the user. Such as every 3 days, once a week, once a fortnight, etc. Then each user can use the frequency that best suits them.

Thanks for consideration!


_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/ad-away/issues/detail?id=283_
title: Possibility to configure other time periods for the auto updates

body: _Original author: nemchik (July 12, 2012 09:51:28)_ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Have ad away installed and hosts loaded to /system/etc/hosts 2.install a from update (cm9 in this case) that formats /system but leaves /data thus ad away is still installed 3.boot up and open ad away and even though hosts was replaced by from update and is now blank, ad away thinks there is no update and ad blocking is turned on What is the expected output? "Disabled" Ad away shouldn't show disabled when an outside source or procedure modifies the hosts file just because the file reads that its been modified at a newer date than the latest host sources. What do you see instead? "Newest hosts files enabled" Please enable Debug Logging in preferences of AdAway, install aLogcat and save a logfile while reproducing the problem. The logfile can be attached to this issue. Will provide if needed, but it shouldn't be. What version of AdAway are you using? 1.36 (37) What Android version? 4.0.4 What custom rom? cm-9-20120711-NIGHTLY-i777 Please provide any additional information below. I think (just speculating) that ad away uses the hosts file's "last modified time/date" attribute of the file to determine if it needs to update rather than a time stamp placed in comments of the hosts file itself. _Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/ad-away/issues/detail?id=278_
title: AdAway shows hosts file up to date incorrectly after Rom reflashing

body: _Original author: chrismit...@gmail.com (July 09, 2012 21:28:23)_ I'd like to add hosts entries with multiple aliases for a single IP. For example: 192.168.1.0 hostname alias1 alias2 However, Ad-Away doesn't appear to allow this; it throws an "invalid hostname" error when attempting to enter multiple space-separated names into the hostname field. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start Ad-Away and go into "Your Lists" -> "Redirection". 2. Tap the "+" button to add a new entry 3. Enter multiple hostname aliases in the "hostname" field, separated by spaces, and enter a valid IP in the IP field. Tap "Add". What is the expected output? What do you see instead? I would expect Ad-Away to add the line to the hosts file as I've entered it, since space-separated aliases are valid hosts entries. Instead, the error "Malformed hostname -- This is not a valid hostname!" appears and the entry does not save. What version of AdAway are you using? What Android version? What custom rom? body:
_Original author: hgm...@gmail.com (October 23, 2011 11:25:16)_

The proposed workaround in "Problems" does not quite work, because the ln command cannot create a link when the file of the same name (hosts) is still there. Proposal:

cd /system/etc
mv hosts /data/data
ln -s /data/data/hosts hosts

Instead of the mv line one could also use:

rm hosts

but it may be a tad better to keep the hosts file for a moment and create the same situation that will be there later, with a hosts file already in /data/data .

It would be nice if this could be automated further. Perhaps a good way would be to create a little zip file that can be installed with ROM Manager and that performs the operation, along with another zip file that reverts to the original state.


_Original issue: http://code.google.com/p/ad-away/issues/detail?id=106_
title: S-ON/S-OFF Workaround improvement
